name: Ancient Egypt
description: Civilization along the Nile, famous for pharaohs, pyramids, and hieroglyphs.

name: Ancient Greece
description: City-states, philosophy, democracy, and classical art.

name: Ancient Rome
description: Republic and Empire, law, engineering, and military conquests.

name: Mesopotamia
description: The cradle of civilization: Sumerians, Akkadians, Babylonians, Assyrians.

name: Ancient China
description: Dynasties, Confucianism, Great Wall, and early inventions.

name: Medieval Europe
description: Feudalism, knights, castles, and the Catholic Church’s influence.

name: Renaissance
description: Cultural rebirth, art, science, and humanism.

name: Islamic Golden Age
description: Science, philosophy, math, and cultural flowering across the Islamic world.

name: Viking Age
description: Scandinavian seafarers, exploration, and raids.

name: Precolonial North America
description: Indigenous North American cultures—Mississippian, Hopewell, Ancestral Pueblo, Iroquois.

name: Mongol Empire
description: Largest contiguous land empire, trade, and conquest across Eurasia.

name: Byzantine Empire
description: Eastern Roman Empire, Orthodox Christianity, and monumental architecture.

name: Industrial Revolution
description: Technological, economic, and social changes from 18th–19th century.

name: Modern Era
description: 20th–21st century global history, wars, technology, and politics.

name: Ottoman Empire
description: Multiethnic empire bridging Europe, Asia, and Africa.

name: Sub-Saharan Kingdoms
description: West and Central African empires like Mali, Songhai, and Great Zimbabwe.

name: Mesoamerica
description: Ancient civilizations of Mexico and Central America, like Maya and Aztec.

name: Andean Civilizations
description: Pre-Columbian cultures of the Andes, including Inca, Moche, and Nazca.

name: Ancient India
description: Early Indian civilizations including Indus Valley and Vedic culture.

name: Persian Empire
description: Empire from Greece to India known for tolerance, roads, and rulers like Cyrus.

name: Imperial China
description: Dynastic China from Qin to Qing

name: Early Islamic Period
description: Founding phase of Islam with rapid expansion and early caliphate rule.

name: Baroque
description: Highly ornate, dramatic art style with bold motion and emotional intensity.

name: Pirates
description: Seafaring outlaws known for raiding ships, hidden treasure, and skull-and-crossbones lore.

name: Classical Japan
description: Imperial court, literature, and culture flourish.

name: Feudal Japan
description: Era of samurai, ninja, castles, clans, and constant internal warfare.

name: Modern Japan
description: Time of Meiji Restoration, rapid modernization, industrialization, and military expansion.

name: Colonial Spanish America
description: Spanish conquest, colonization, and independence wars across South America.

name: Colonial and Imperial Brazil
description: Portuguese colonization, economic growth, and transition to Brazilian Empire.

name: Precolonial Southeast Asia
description: Southeast Asian civilizations before European contact—Khmer, Majapahit, Pagan, Srivijaya.

name: West African Empires
description: The great empires of West Africa—Ghana, Mali, Songhai, Hausa, Yoruba states.

name: Silk Road
description: Trans-Eurasian trade cultures—Sogdians, oasis cities, Central Asian khanates.

name: Polynesia and Oceania
description: Pacific civilizations—Lapita, Māori, Hawaiians, navigators of Polynesia and Micronesia.

name: Early Modern Europe
description: Europe from 1500–1789—Reformation, absolutism, scientific revolution, revolutions of thought.

name: Reformation and Religious Wars
description: Protestant Reformation, Catholic response, and the great religious wars of Europe.

name: Colonial Southeast Asia
description: European rule in Southeast Asia—Dutch East Indies, Philippines, Indochina, British Malaya.

name: The Enlightenment
description: Age of reason—philosophy, science, and political thought shaping the modern world.

name: Cold War
description: Global rivalry between the US and USSR—proxy wars, nuclear politics, geopolitics.

name: Globalization
description: Modern interconnected world—global trade, technology, communication, migration.

name: Black History
description: History of Black communities, from slavery and diaspora to civil rights and culture.

name: Feminism
description: Movements for women’s rights, equality, and social, political, and economic liberation.

name: Pre-Columbian Brazil
description: Indigenous societies and cultures before European arrival.

name: Post-Independence South America
description: Era after Spanish colonies gained independence.

name: Colonial North America
description: Includes early exploration, colonization, European settlement, and pre-Revolutionary society.

name: Early Republic
description: From independence through the early federal period, westward expansion, and up to the Civil War.

name: Gilded Age
description: Rapid US industrial growth with wealth, inequality, and labor unrest.

name: Modern China
description: The post-imperial era marked by rapid reform, conflict, and major global rise.

name: Prehistory
description: Early humans, tools, art, and the rise of civilization.

name: WWII
description: Global conflict from 1939–1945 reshaping nations, politics, and societies.

name: British Empire
description: The global empire of the United Kingdom, spanning colonies, protectorates, and dominions.

name: French Empire
description: France's overseas empire, including colonies in North America, Africa, and Asia.

name: Spanish Empire
description: Spain's empire encompassing the Americas, Asia, and Europe, a dominant global power.

name: Dutch Empire
description: The overseas holdings of the Netherlands, focused on trade and colonies.

name: Portuguese Empire
description: Portugal's global maritime empire, one of the earliest European global empires.

name: Human Migrations
description: Key prehistoric human migrations showing the spread of humans across continents.
